## Doing and saving simulations

```{r quant_gen-arg-maker, echo = TRUE}
# Create list for running a set of simulations:
quant_gen_args <- function(eta_sign, d_sign, q) {
    # List for all parameters:
    args <- list(n_cores = 4, q = q)
    # the non-additive effects of traits on `r`:
    args$eta <- 0.01 * sign(eta_sign)
    # changes how the focal line's traits affect other lines' effects of competition:
    args$d <- 0.1 * sign(d_sign)
    if (args$d > 0) args$d <- 1e-4 # <-- high d takes a very long time to run
    return(args)
}
```


### Two traits


```{r, run_sims_q2, eval = FALSE, echo = TRUE}
# Takes ~ 2.1 hrs
set.seed(2028111205)
seeds <- sample.int(.Machine$integer.max, 9)  # <- so individual runs can be re-evaluated
q <- 2
i <- 1
for (e in -1:1) {
    for (d in -1:1) {
        args <- quant_gen_args(e, d, q)
        cat(sprintf("\n\neta: %.2f || d: %.2f (%i / 9) \n", args$eta, args$d, i))
        set.seed(seeds[i])
        qg <- do.call(quant_gen, args)
        fn <- sprintf("results/quant_gen/q%i/eta=%s__d=%s.rds", q, e, d)
        saveRDS(qg, fn, compress = FALSE)
        i <- i + 1
    }
}
```
